protocol.text: The data were gcRMA-normalized in R using the gcrma package and filtered to remove all probesets that did not have a MAS5.0 present call in at least three of the arrays. ID_REF =  VALUE = gcRMA expression values

Above-ground portions of seedlings were collected using forceps and immediately placed in conical tubes in liquid nitrogen, one tube per replicate. To minimize the effect of collection time, small batches of seedlings were collected for a given tube before moving onto the next one, cycling between all nine tubes until the desired total number of seedlings was achieved in each tube.

Seeds of wild-type Col-0, cct-1, and gct-2 were sown in Fafard #2 soil. The flats were placed at 4oC for three days before being put in a Conviron growth chamber at a constant 23oC under a one-to-one ratio of T8 Sylvania Octron 4100K Ecologic and GroLite WS fluorescent lamps (Interlectric) at ~125 μmol m-2 s-1. Plants were grown under long day conditions—16 hr light (100-125 μmol m-2 s-1):8 hr dark. Above-ground portions of seedlings were harvested when the first two leaf primordia were 1 mm in length, which was at day 7 for wild-type seedlings and day 9 for the two mutants. Only seedlings that produced cotyledons and leaf primordia were used. 75-100 seedlings were used per biological replicate.

The seedlings were ground in liquid nitrogen and then Trizol (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA) with a mortar and pestle. After extraction with chloroform (1/5th volume of the Trizol), per the manufacturer’s instructions, the aqueous phase was combined with � volume of 100% ethanol, mixed and passed over an RNeasy Mini (Qiagen, Valencia, CA) column. The RNA was further purified according to the RNeasy Mini directions, including an on-column DNA digestion with Qiagen’s RNase-Free DNase Set. The final RNA was eluted in the provided RNase-free water, and 1 ul of RNasin was added to increase stability.

Biotin-labeled cDNA targets were made from 50 ng starting RNA that was reverse-transcribed and amplified using the OvationTM RNA Amplification SystemV2 and fragmented and labeled using the FL-OvationTM cDNA Biotin Module V2 (NuGEN Technologies, San Carlos, CA) per the manufacturer’s instructions.

Affymetrix ATH1 GeneChips were hybridized with 3.75 ug of biotin-labeled cDNA at a concentration of 17 ng/ul in the hybridization coctail. Hybridization was carried out for 16-18 hours at 45oC. Washing and staining were done using a GeneChip Fluidics Station 450.
The GeneChips were scanned using a 7G Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner.
